text: i think release schedules should be
unpredictable including to the people
that are writing the software what i
mean by this is that you should always
submit code to your repository with the
notion in the back of your head that
this might get released at any moment in
time and doing things like a change that
is split up across two different review
units but that changes behavior in
between in a way that is breaking is
probably something you shouldn't do and
a good way to enforce this sort of thing
and instill this sort of mindset in
people is to make things kind of a
little bit unpredictable so do regular
releases of your services just as an
example every n hours but n is a range
from say three to eight and you don't
exactly know there's no such thing as a
merge window or a release window so
that's like a release monkey right yeah
they like the phrase like a release
market like from the chaos monkey a
release monkey any time you get a
release any time that's great yeah okay
i like that
[Music]
